channel.title: git on Kev's 9th blog
channel.description: Recent content in git on Kev's 9th blog

item.title: How to catch up my git fork to master
item.description: How to catch up my git fork to master Configuring a git remote for a fork You only need to do this once: Add a new remote upstream repository to sync with the fork where ORIGINAL_OWNER is the original GitHub account and ORIGINAL_REPOSITORY is the original repository name. git remote add upstream https://github.com/ORIGINAL_OWNER/ORIGINAL_REPOSITORY.git For example: git remote add upstream https://github.com/apache/thrift.git You can verify that all went well: git remote -v origin https://github.
